title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk says he must approve all new hires in internal email
description: "No one can join Tesla, even as a contractor, until you receive my email approval," Musk wrote in an email to everybody at Tesla.

title: U.S. Virgin Islands issued subpoena to Elon Musk in Jeffrey Epstein lawsuit
description: Elon Musk is the latest big name issued a subpoena by the U.S. Virgin Islands for its lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase over sex trafficking by Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Treasury Secretary Yellen reaffirms U.S. could run out of money to pay bills by early June
description: Citing additional data, Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen reaffirmed to Congress that the U.S. could default on its debt as early as June 1.

title: Microsoft releases update that allows iPhone users to text from Windows
description: PC users want the ability to text from their laptops at work or at school.

title: 'Guardians of the Galaxy: Vol. 3' had best second weekend box office hold for MCU in 5 years
description: Guardians' second weekend box office drop was the smallest one for the Marvel Cinematic Universe since the original "Black Panther" in 2018.

title: Why investors 'always misunderstand' the difficulty of regaining a loss, says advisor
description: To return to baseline, investors must always get a better return relative to their initial loss.

title: Elon Musk still needs 'Twitter sitter,' judges rule
description: Elon Musk had been fighting to unwind parts of a settlement agreement he and Tesla struck with the SEC over civil securities fraud charges in 2018.

title: Consumer debt passes $17 trillion for the first time despite slide in mortgage demand
description: The total for borrowing across all categories hit $17.05 trillion, an increase of nearly $150 billion, or 0.9% during the January-to-March period.

title: Southeast Asia hit with record-breaking heat and heavy air pollution
description: Bangkok, the capital city of Thailand, experienced a record temperature of 105.8 degrees Fahrenheit (41 degrees Celsius) over the weekend.

title: EU approves Microsoft's $69 billion acquisition of Activision Blizzard, clearing major hurdle
description: Microsoft offered remedies in cloud gaming to earn the approval of European Union regulators for the $69 billion Activision Blizzard acquisition.

title: Biden says he's 'optimistic' about a debt ceiling deal as leaders prepare for Tuesday meeting
description: President Joe Biden sounds optimistic about the odds of reaching a deal with Republicans to raise or suspend the debt limit.

title: Paul Tudor Jones says the Fed is done raising rates, stocks to finish the year higher from here
description: Paul Tudor Jones believes the Fed has finished raising interest rates in its fight against inflation, and the stock market could grind higher this year.

title: UK launches first full-sized autonomous bus service with top speed of 50 miles per hour
description: A fleet of five buses will be involved, travelling in mixed traffic.

title: Turkey's lira and stock markets slide as President Erdogan gains momentum in tight presidential race
description: Neither 20-year incumbent Recep Tayyip Erdogan nor Kemal Kilicdaroglu has so far cleared the 50% threshold needed to secure an outright victory.

title: Platinum demand predicted to surge this year, leaving a near 1-million-ounce deficit
description: The previously anticipated platinum shortage will be worse than expected this year due to increased demand, according to the World Platinum Investment Council.

title: Vice Media files for bankruptcy to enable sale to lenders including Soros and Fortress
description: Once a digital media darling, Vice Media Group on Monday filed for bankruptcy protection after years of financial troubles.

title: Turkey faces unprecedented election runoff after Erdogan looks unlikely to win outright
description: The election in the sharply divided country of 85 million people could hardly come at a more pivotal time.

title: Amazon is focusing on using A.I. to get stuff delivered to you faster
description: Amazon aims to use artificial intelligence to speed up deliveries — by minimizing the distance between its products and customers, a top executive told CNBC.

title: Europe takes aim at ChatGPT with what might soon be the West’s first A.I. law. Here's what it means
description: A committee of lawmakers in the European Parliament on Thursday approved the EU’s AI Act, moving it further along to becoming law.

title: Thai stocks reverse gains as opposition parties secure strong majority in election
description: It remains to be seen which parties will eventually form the new Thai government as a coalition is needed since both opposition parties don't have enough votes to form a new government.

title: China doesn't really care who wins the war in Ukraine — it just wants to win the peace, analysts say
description: Political analysts question whether China has the diplomatic skills — and perceived neutrality — needed to bring Russia and Ukraine to the negotiating table.
